intro: Monnina loxensis, commonly known as the slender monnina, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes buckwheat and other related plants. The plant is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from pink to purple. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture. Monnina loxensis is often found in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in full sun.
